body: Since it is entirely certain (from logs) that the worker will get ClassNotFound errors, and Jenkins is busted again, I will merge this.
R: @tgroh (original reviewer) or anyone after the fact
looks good to me
Rebase and rebuild: https://builds.apache.org/view/Beam/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/10078/

R: @peihe @ssisk @davorbonaci 
CC: @vikkyrk
https://builds.apache.org/view/Beam/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/10079/

Stupid Travis still being broken. (That's a bug for a larger hackathon :p)

Overview: This looks pretty much perfect as-is -- great, though I'd probably defer review to @aviemzur who implemented the Spark metrics connector.

However, I wonder is this test needed given that the `MetricsTest` runs in the Spark `@ValidatesRunner` suite? I can see it either way -- the `MetricsTest` is more of an integration test.
Manual build started: https://builds.apache.org/view/Beam/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/10086/
https://builds.apache.org/view/Beam/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/2946/
Built on Jenkins ok so merging.
Rebase & test. Probably want to check the ValidatesRunner suites somewhat just to be sure.
LGTM. Need to make sure that if we change `commons-lang3` version in Beam parent in the future it will be done with care so that this doesn't break Spark in cluster mode.

https://github.com/apache/beam-site/pull/225

R: @aviemzur  will handle pushing across the finish line, I shouldn't have interjected. Sorry :)

Pulling out the error:

```
Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.17:check (default) 
on project beam-sdks-parent:
Failed during checkstyle execution:
Unable to find suppressions file at location: beam/suppressions.xml:
Could not find resource 'beam/suppressions.xml'. -> [Help 1]
```

To be honest, it seems wrong that it ever works, since the actually invalid relative path is resolved sort of randomly to a place that the `pom.xml` in question doesn't even own but is pulled in by the dependency set up. But best would be to just fix it for Travis (if we care; Jenkins is back) rather than spend time on it.

Side note: we should probably also fully qualify our resources, so `org/apache/beam/suppressions.xml`.
Possibly maven version? We could `apt-get` it if so.

r: @dhalperi
Obsolete? Close?
Obsolete? Close?
I specifically placed this into test/ because I don't expect users to write tests that use TestCredential since I don't expect users to write tests that interact with a GCP service directly.

This is likely a versioning issue. The thing is that after we solve this one, there are more issues coming up, unfortunately. Overall, I don't think this is worth the time right now. I'd prefer just to disable Travis.
